i installed lucid on my dell laptop: there is a key to start bluetooth but even if i start it no effect
Is there any output from 'lsmod|grep bluetooth' in your terminal?
Ok run 'sudo modprobe bluetooth' and pastebin if there is any error message
i did modprobe bluetooth..it dint produce any error
Now check the output of 'lsmod|grep bluetooth' again. It should show the module is loaded
And now restart sys>prefs>bluetooth and see what it says
You need to do 'sudo service bluetooth start' or 'sudo /etc/init.d/bluetooth start'
You need to get the bluetooth service started. Are those commands failing or giving any error?

I don't know but I suspect the problem is that bluetooth is off in hardware on boot so it doesn't load the module. It might be a good idea to put 'bluetooth' in /etc/modules so it loads it by default then reboot
